block.p: Shareen Hertel, a daughter of Margaret Fisher Hertel and Philip J. Hertel of Grand Rapids, Mich., was married yesterday to Donald W. Swinton, a son of Helen Meek Swinton of New York and the late Stanley M. Swinton. The Rev. Riley Jensen officiated at the Westminster Presbyterian Church in Grand Rapids. The Rev. Matthew Fitzgerald, a United Church of Christ minister and cousin of the bridegroom, took part in the ceremony.

Ms. Hertel, 34, is keeping her name. She is a doctoral candidate in political science at Columbia University, from which she received a master's degree in international affairs. She graduated from the College of Wooster, in Ohio. Her father teaches mathematics at East Grand Rapids Middle School. Her mother retired as the copy editor at Gemini Publications, which publishes Grand Rapids Magazine, Grand Rapids Parent and The Grand Rapids Business Journal.

Shareen Hertel, a daughter of Margaret Fisher Hertel and Philip J. Hertel of Grand Rapids, Mich., was married yesterday to Donald W. Swinton, a son of Helen Meek Swinton of New York and the late Stanley M. Swinton. The Rev. Riley Jensen officiated at the Westminster Presbyterian Church in Grand Rapids. The Rev. Matthew Fitzgerald, a United Church of Christ minister and cousin of the bridegroom, took part in the ceremony.

Ms. Hertel, 34, is keeping her name. She is a doctoral candidate in political science at Columbia University, from which she received a master's degree in international affairs. She graduated from the College of Wooster, in Ohio. Her father teaches mathematics at East Grand Rapids Middle School. Her mother retired as the copy editor at Gemini Publications, which publishes Grand Rapids Magazine, Grand Rapids Parent and The Grand Rapids Business Journal.

Mr. Swinton, 41, is the managing editor for global news at BridgeNews, a division of Bridge Information Systems, a financial news and data supplier in New York. He graduated from Dickinson College. His father was a vice president and the director of world services of The Associated Press in New York.
